TopicTitle: Game Lags like Hell when looking down Kerbin Ground.

Articles.Content:
Does not occur on other planets (Though I only tested on the Moon and Eeloo, only kerbin seems to have this problem. Also did not occur before the 1.0 update. 

Looking up in sky = 60 fps, looking down to ground = 22-34 fps. And it drops instantly. 

It does not matter if you are near the KSP launch pad, you can be on opposite of the planet and still have this ridiculous drop.

Also I am flying a low part count stock ship. So its not the part count that cause the FPS drop and neither is the Launch pad or buildings. 

My system:

i5-4670k

AMD 7950 Boost

2560x1080 Resolution

Latest AMD beta Drivers

Does not matter which settings, low or high still have this problem.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-09T21:56:33Z" title="05/09/2015 09:56  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 9, 2015</time> by tempsgk**

I've always had this, in fact in space I have to orientate my view to a particular bit of sky so my framerate doesn't drop through the floor.

Another trick I've found is to switch to map view and zoom all the way out, which makes my framerate suddenly increase for some bizarre reason.

OK so this is clearly a bug. Just now created a new career save and I had no fps drop. I am playing normally. After this I exit the career game, create a sandbox game and no bug! No fps drop. So I exit the game to desktop and restarted and went back to my career save and the bug came back. Tried doing the first step but still have that bug. 

So again clearly a bug, but trying to repeat is random.

It's due to the way water is rendered (poorly), all AMD GPUs (such as the one you have) are effected by this, regardless of how powerful the GPU is. Thus when you look at the water (which is also below the ground) a massive lag spike will occur.

This happens to me too! ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif)

And i have 2 GPU-s: Intel HD Graphics 4600 and Nvidia GeForce 710M

4 GB RAM

1600x900 resolution

Latest drivers
